title: Computational Design of Dynamic Biosensors - Benzylfentanyl
description:
## Summary

Design campaign for biosensors detecting benzylfentanyl with nanomolar
sensitivity using Latent Labs Platform

## Detailed Description

Design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to engineer biosensors for
detecting benzylfentanyl opioids based on the plant abscisic acid receptor PYR1.
The campaign employed computational design and optimization to develop sensors
with low nanomolar sensitivity for detecting benzylfentanyl in complex
biological samples.

title: Computational Design of Soluble CCR8 Analogues
description:
## Summary

Design campaign for soluble CCR8 receptor analogues that maintain antibody
binding function using Latent Labs Platform

## Detailed Description

Computational design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to generate soluble
CCR8 analogues. Achieved 62% experimental success rate with 8/13 designs showing
soluble expression and maintained antibody binding with KD values 77-857nM,
comparable to wild-type CCR8.

title: Computational Design of Conformation-Biasing Mutations - ACE2
description:
## Summary

Design campaign for conformation-biasing mutations targeting ACE2 to alter
protein conformational states using Latent Labs Platform

## Detailed Description

Design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to predict mutations that bias
ACE2 toward specific conformational states. The campaign employed computational
design to identify mutations that engineer improved or altered protein functions
through conformational control, with implications for SARS-CoV-2 binding and
therapeutic development.

title: Computational Design of Conformation-Biasing Mutations - DARPin K27
description:
## Summary

Design campaign for conformation-biasing mutations targeting DARPin K27 to
alter protein conformational states using Latent Labs Platform

## Detailed Description

Design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to predict mutations that bias
DARPin K27 toward specific conformational states. The campaign employed
computational design to identify mutations across multiple bacterial enzyme
targets and demonstrated ability to engineer improved or altered protein
functions through conformational control.

title: Computational Design of Conformation-Biasing Mutations - RALGDS
description:
## Summary

Design campaign for conformation-biasing mutations targeting RALGDS to alter
protein conformational states using Latent Labs Platform

## Detailed Description

Design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to predict mutations that bias
RALGDS toward specific conformational states. The campaign employed
computational design to identify mutations that engineer improved or altered
protein functions through conformational control, focusing on Ras signaling and
GPCR interactions.

title: Computational Enzyme Design by Catalytic Motif Scaffolding - 2-Cyclohexenone
description:
## Summary

Design campaign using Latent Labs Platform for creating de novo
Morita-Baylis-Hillman enzymes targeting 2-cyclohexenone

## Detailed Description

Computational design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to create
Morita-Baylis-Hillman enzymes from scratch by scaffolding catalytic arrays into
de novo protein backbones. The campaign successfully designed enzymes targeting
2-cyclohexenone with activities rivaling evolved variants.

title: Computational Design of Miniprotein Binders - Chikungunya Virus
description:
## Summary

Design campaign for novel miniprotein binders targeting Chikungunya virus
(CHIKV) entry proteins using Latent Labs Platform

## Detailed Description

Design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to create miniprotein binders
targeting the CHIKV envelope protein. The campaign integrated backbone
generation, docking, sequence design, and extensive filtering using structural
predictions and molecular dynamics simulations to generate potential therapeutic
candidates against Chikungunya virus.

title: Computational Design of Miniprotein Binders - Dengue Virus
description:
## Summary

Design campaign for novel miniprotein binders targeting Dengue virus (DENV)
entry proteins using Latent Labs Platform

## Detailed Description

Design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to create miniprotein binders
targeting the DENV envelope fusion loop. The campaign integrated backbone
generation, docking, sequence design, and extensive filtering using structural
predictions and molecular dynamics simulations to generate potential therapeutic
candidates against Dengue virus.

title: Generative Design of High-Affinity Peptide Binders - MDM2
description:
## Summary

Design campaign using Latent Labs Platform for generating short peptide binders
targeting MDM2 with nanomolar affinity

## Detailed Description

Computational design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform for generating
short peptide binders (10-20 amino acids) targeting the MDM2-p53 interface. The
campaign achieved nanomolar binding affinities and demonstrated structure-guided
optimization through peptide stapling to disrupt the MDM2-p53 interaction.

title: Generative Design of High-Affinity Peptide Binders - PD-1/PD-L1
description:
## Summary

Design campaign using Latent Labs Platform for generating short peptide binders
targeting PD-1/PD-L1 with nanomolar affinity

## Detailed Description

Computational design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform for generating
short peptide binders (10-20 amino acids) targeting the PD-1/PD-L1 immune
checkpoint interface. The campaign achieved nanomolar binding affinities and
demonstrated structure-guided optimization through peptide stapling to modulate
immune responses.

title: Generative Design of High-Affinity Peptide Binders - WDR5
description:
## Summary

Design campaign using Latent Labs Platform for generating short peptide binders
targeting WDR5 with nanomolar affinity

## Detailed Description

Computational design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform for generating
short peptide binders (10-20 amino acids) targeting WDR5 protein interfaces. The
campaign focused on disrupting WDR5 interactions with MLL and MYC, achieving
nanomolar binding affinities and demonstrating structure-guided optimization
through peptide stapling.

title: Computational Design of pH-Sensitive Protein Binders - EphA2
description:
## Summary

Design campaign for pH-sensitive protein binders targeting EphA2 that
dissociate at acidic pH using Latent Labs Platform

## Detailed Description

Design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to create pH-sensitive protein
binders targeting EphA2 through introducing histidine residues adjacent to
positively charged residues at binding interfaces to induce electrostatic
repulsion at low pH. The designs were validated experimentally and showed
pH-dependent binding with up to 1000-fold weaker binding at pH 5.4 compared to
pH 7.4, enabling applications in targeted protein degradation and
tumor-selective therapeutics.

title: Computational Design of pH-Sensitive Protein Binders - IL-6
description:
## Summary

Design campaign for pH-sensitive protein binders targeting IL-6 that dissociate
at acidic pH using Latent Labs Platform

## Detailed Description

Design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to create pH-sensitive protein
binders targeting IL-6 through incorporating buried histidine-containing charged
networks in the protein core that destabilize under acidic conditions. The
designs were validated experimentally and showed pH-dependent binding with up to
1000-fold weaker binding at pH 5.4 compared to pH 7.4, enabling applications in
inflammatory disease treatment and tumor-selective therapeutics.

title: Computational Design of Metallohydrolases
description:
## Summary

Design campaign for highly active zinc metallohydrolases using Latent Labs Platform

## Detailed Description

Design campaign utilizing Latent Labs Platform to create zinc metallohydrolases
directly from quantum chemistry calculations of active sites. The approach
generated multiple enzymes with high catalytic efficiency without requiring
experimental optimization.
